question: Which of the following is NOT a fundamental S.I unit?
A simple pendulum with a period of 2.0s has its length doubled. Its new period is

Which of the following statements are true about the spring balance and the chemical balance? i. both are used to measure the mass of an object. ii. either of them may be used to measure the weight of an object. iii. the spring balance works on the principle of Hooke's law while the chemical balance works on the principle of moments. iv. a change in gravity does the readings of a spring balance but not that of a chemical balance.

Which of the following types of motion are oscillatory? i.a diving board when used by a diver. ii. the motion of the balance wheel of a wrist watch. iii. the motion of the turn-table of a record player. iv. the motion of the center of a ten kobo piece as it rolls down an inclined plane. v. the motion of the needle of a D.C. ammeter into which a low A.C. current is passed
If a car starts from rest and moves with a uniform acceleration of 10ms<sup>-2</sup>for ten seconds, the distance it covers in the last one second of its motion is
explanation:
Distance in 105, using, x = ut + \(\frac{1}{2}\)at2

x = (0 x 10) + (\(\frac{1}{2}\) x 10 x 10 x 10) = 500m

distance in 9s; x - (0 x 9) + (\(\frac{1}{2}\) x 10 x 9 x 9) = 405m

distance in last is = difference

= 500 - 405

= 95m

question: A block of mass 2.04kg resting on a smooth horizontal plane is acted upon simultaneously by two-forces, 10N due North and 10N due East. The magnitude of the acceleration produced by the force on the block is

A metal block of mass 5kg lies on a rough horizontal platform. If a horizontal force of 8N applied to the block through its center of mass just slides the block on the platform, then the coefficient of limiting friction between the block and platform is
Which of the following is NOT a force?
Two masses 40g and 60g respectively, are attached firmly to the ends of the light meter rule. The center of gravity of the system is
options: at the mid-point of the meter rule
indeterninate because the meter-rule is light

question: A 0.05kg bullet travelling at 500ms<sup>-1</sup>horizontally strikes a thick vertical wall. It stops after penetrating through the wall horizontal distance of 0.25m. What is the magnitude of the average force the wall exerts on the bullet?
A force of 100N stretches an elastic string to a total length of 20cm. If an additional force of 100N stretches the string 5cm further, Find the natural length of the string
explanation:
Using, f1= f2

e1= 20 - L ; e2 = 5cm

\(\frac{f_1}{e_1}\) = \(\frac{f_2}{e_2}\)

\(\frac{100}{20 - L}\) = \(\frac{100}{5}\)

hence, L = 15cm

question: Two divers G and H are at depths 20m and 40m respectively below the water surface in a lake. The pressure on G is P<sub>1</sub>while the pressure on H is P<sub>2</sub>. If the atmospheric pressure is equivalent to 10m of water, then the value of \( \frac{p_2}{p_1} \) is
explanation:
pressure at H = 40m ; pressure at G, p1= 20m

\(\frac{p_1}{p_1}\) = \(\frac{40}{20}\)

= 2

question: The areas of the effort and load pistons of a hydraulic press are 0.5m<sup>2</sup>and 5m<sup>2</sup>respectively. If a force F<sub>1</sub>of 100N is applied on the effort piston, the force F<sub>2</sub>on the load is

A metal cube of volume 10<sup>3</sup>mm<sup>3</sup>is lowered into a measuring cylinder containing water. If the internal cross-sectional area of the cylinder is 1.5 x 10<sup>2</sup>mm<sup>2</sup>, by how much does the water level rise in the cylinder?

A uniform cylindrical block of wood floats in water with one-third of its height above the water level, in a liquid of relative density 0.8, what fraction of its height will be above the liquid level?
explanation:
Height inside H2O = \(\frac{2}{3}\)

R.d = \(\frac{\text{height inside}H_2O}{\text{height inside liquid}}\)

0.8 = \(\frac{\frac{2}{3}}{X}\)

question: A thin aluminum plate has a surface area of 1500m<sup></sup>at 20<sup>o</sup>C. What will be its surface area when it is cooled to -20<sup>o</sup>C? (Take the linear expansivity of aluminum to be 2.5 x 10<sup>-5</sup>k<sup>-1</sup>).

Two liquids, P at a temperature of 20<sup>o</sup>C and Q at a temperature of 80<sup>o</sup>C have specific heat capacities of 1.0Jkg<sup>-1</sup><sup>o</sup>C<sup>-1</sup>and 1.5J kg<sup>-1</sup><sup>o</sup>C<sup>-1</sup>respectively. if equal masses of P and Q are mixed in a lagged calorimeter, then the equilibrium temperature is
explanation:
Heat lost = heat gained

m x (80 - \(\theta\)) x 1.5 = m x (\(\theta\) - 20) x 1

\(\theta\) = 56oC

question: A quantity of gas occupies a certain volume when the temperature is -73<sup>o</sup>C and the pressure is 1.5 atmospheres. If the pressure is increased to 4.5 atmospheres and the volume is halved at the same time, what will be the new temperature of the gas?
In a gas experiment, the pressure of the gas is plotted against the reciprocal of the volume of the gas at a constant temperature. the unit of the slope of the resulting curve is
Water shows anomalous behaviour.

Two thermo flasks of volume Vx and Vy are filled with liquid water at an initial temperature of 0<sup>o</sup>C. After sometime the temperature were found to be 9x, 9y, respectively. Given that \(\frac{Vx}{Vy}\) = 2 and \(\frac{\theta x}{\theta y}\) = \(\frac{1}{2}\) the ratio of the heat flow into the flask is
explanation:
Heat = mc\(\theta\)

Hx= Dxx Vxx Cxx \(\theta\)x

Hy= Dyx Vyx Cyx \(\theta\)y

\(\frac{H_x}{H_y}\) = \(\frac{D_x \times V_x \times C_x \times \theta_x}{D_x \times V_x \times C_x \times \theta_x}\)

= 2 x \(\frac{1}{2}\)

= 1

question: A good calorimeter should be of
options: low specific heat capacity and low heat conductivity
low specific heat capacity and high heat conductivity
high specific heat capacity and low heat conductivity
high specific heat capacity and low heat conductivity
dull surface and low heat conductivity

question: Which of the following statements are NOT correct?
explanation: The saturated vapour pressure is dependent on the temperature of the liquid and not on the volume.
options: boiling occurs when the saturated vapour pressure of the liquid involved equals the external pressure
both the boiling point and the saturated vapour pressure of a given liquid depends on the external pressure
the saturated vapour presssure rises with increase in temperature
the saturated vapour pressure is independent of the volume available for the vapour
it is possible to boil water at a lower temperature than 100<sup>o</sup>C at high altitude

question: Which of the following phenomena CANNOT be explained by the molecular theory of matter?
In order to find the depth of the sea, a ship sends out a sound wave and receives an echo after one second. If the velocity of sound in water is 1500ms<sup>-1</sup>, what is the depth of the sea?
explanation:
Echo time = 1 \(\div\) 2 = 0.5sec

depth = velocity x time

= 1500 x 0.5

= 750m = 0.75km

question: When a sound wave passes from air into water its
options: speed and frequency increases but its wavelength remains the same
speed and wavelength increases but its frequency remains the same
speed remains the same but its frequency and wavelength change
speed increases but its frequency and wavelength decreases

An object is placed 15cm in front of a concave mirror of radius 40cm. The image formed
A 45<sup>o</sup>triangular glass prism can be used as a reflector of light because
options: A refraction never takes place in such a prism
the angle of reflection equals the angle of incidence
the refractive index of glass is less than 1
the critival angle angle for glass is less than 45<sup>o</sup>

question: A convex mirror is used as a driving mirror because i. its image is erect. ii. it has a large field of view. iii. it has a long focal length. Identify the CORRECT statement(s)

Two rays of light from a point below the surface of water are equally inclined to each other at 60<sup>o</sup>in water. What is the angle between the rays when they emerge into air? (Take the refractive index of water to be \(\frac{4}{3}\))
explanation:
\(\frac{4}{3}\) = \(\frac{sin r_1}{sin 30}\) and \(\frac{4}{3}\) = \(\frac{sin r_2}{sin 30}\)

r1= 41.8oand r2= 41.8o

angle between them = r1+ r2

= 83.6o

question: A narrow beam of white light can be split up into different colours by a glass prism. The correct explanation is that
options: white light is an electromagnetic wave
the prism has all the colours of the white light
white light has undergone total internal reflection in the prism
different colours of white light travel with different speeds in glass
white ligth consist of yellow, green and red colours

question: A charge of one coulomb liberates 0.0033g of copper in an electrolytic process. How long will it take a current of 2A to librate 1.98g of copper in such a process?
explanation:
0.0033g = 1 coulomb

1.98gs = 1.98 x 1

= 600 cou.

Q = It

600 = 2 x t

t = 300sec = 5 mins

question: If the distance between two stationary charged particle is doubled, the magnitude of the electro-static force between them will be
explanation:
F \(\alpha\) \(\frac{1}{d^2}\)

F x d2= constant

F1x (d1)2= F2x (d2)2

d2= 2d1

F1x (d1)2= F2x (2d1)2

F2= \(\frac{1}{4}\)F1
options: a quarter of its former value

question: Which of the following methods CANNOT be used to produce a steel magnet? The
options: passing of an electric current through a solenoid
repeated stroking of the specimen with a magnet
repeated stroking of the specimen in opposite directions with magnets
hammering of the specimen in the earth's magnetic field

options: parallel resistance equal to milliammeter resistance

options: A galvanometer can be converted to an ammeter with a different range by connecting a high resistance in series
An electric current always produces a magnetic field
Maxwell's screw rule states that if a corkscrew moves inthe direction of the current, the hand turns in the direction of the lines of force

question: A transformer has a primary coil with 500 turns and a secondary coil with 2500 turns. When the voltage input to the primary coil is 120V, the output is

options: The substances in solution in the electrolyte become ionized
Ions are electrically charged and are attracted towards electrodes when a potential difference is applied
Ions may be discharged at the electrodes, forming bubbles or deposits
The mass deposited depends upon the length of time for which current flows
The mass of gas set free or metal deposited is proportional to the square of the current

question: Which of the following statements is NOT correct?
options: The average range of distinct vision for a normal eye is from the far distance (infinity) up to about 25cm in front of the eye
Longsighted people have difficulty in making the eye lense sufficiently powerful to focus on nearby objects
Shortsighted people cannot accommodate distant objects
Longsighted people need diverging spectacle lenses
A person with long sight has his eye-ball too short and the image of an object is therefore formed behind the retina

question: Which of the following features is NOT a characteristic of natural radioactivity?
options: Radioactivity is exhibited only by elements of mass number greater than 206
The radioactivity of an element is affected by electric and magnetic fields in the surroundings
Radioactive substances emits three types of radiations, a-rays, \(\beta\)-rays and y-rays
The radioactive element is transformed into a new element

question: What is the number of neutrons in the Uranium isotope \(^{238}_{92}X\)?

Normal atmospheric pressure at sea-level is 10<sup>5</sup>Nm<sup>-2</sup>and the acceleration due to gravity is approximately 10ms<sup>-1</sup>. If the atmosphere has a uniform density of 1kgm<sup>-3</sup>, its height is
explanation:
pressure = h x g x e

105= 10 x h x 1

h = 104
